content: SECTION 1. BONUS DEPRECIATION FOR CERTAIN PROPERTY ACQUIRED DURING 2008. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to special allowances for property acquired between specific dates. Changes include extending deadlines and increasing the allowance percentage. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include changes to various clauses and subsections related to special allowances for property acquisition. Notable changes involve increasing the allowance amount from $4,600 to $8,000 and removing certain clauses and paragraphs. This involves adjustments to dates and definitions in sections 1400N(d) and 168(k) of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change dates for property acquisition special allowances. Effective December 31, 2007, the amendments apply to property placed in service after that date. SEC. 2. ELECTION TO INCREASE MINIMUM TAX CREDIT IN LIEU OF BONUS DEPRECIATION. The amendment adds a new subsection to Section 53 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, allowing corporations to increase the limitation under subsection (c) by an amount equal to the bonus depreciation amount for a taxable year. The bonus depreciation amount is calculated as 35 percent of the excess of the aggregate amount of depreciation under section 168. The new subsection allows corporations to increase the limitation under Section 53 by the bonus depreciation amount for a taxable year. All members of the same controlled group are treated as one corporation. The election under this subsection excludes property from bonus depreciation. The new subsection allows corporations to increase the limitation under Section 53 by the bonus depreciation amount for a taxable year. The credit refundable can only be revoked with the Secretary's consent. Additionally, a cross-reference is made to Section 168(k) for an election to claim additional minimum tax credits.
